articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Kim Rak Hui
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Kim Rak Hui
						
 Pyongyang, February 18 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un Monday sent a wreath to the bier of Kim Rak Hui, deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK and an honorary councilor of the Cabinet, expressing his deep condolences over her death.

articles.title: Overseas Koreans Leave
articles.content:
Overseas Koreans Leave
 Pyongyang, February 18 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the International United Confederation of Koreans headed by Ko Tae Chun, vice-chairperson of the United Confederation of Koreans in Uzbekistan, and Choe Ryong Ho, vice-president of Yanbian University of Science and Technology of China, left here by air on Monday.
					 Departing here earlier were Ri Yong Ho, managing director of Dandong Shengmin Trading Co. Ltd., China, and his party.

articles.title: Foreign Players Visit Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Foreign Players Visit Mangyongdae
						
 Pyongyang, February 18 (KCNA) -- Foreign players from different countries who took part in the 22nd Paektusan Prize International Figure Skating Festival toured Mangyongdae on Monday.
					 They visited the old home of President Kim Il Sung where he was born and spent his childhood, nurturing his noble will for revolution.  There they looked round historic relics, being briefed on the immortal story about the history of the old home. 
					
					 They had a picture taken in front of it and went round revolutionary relics on Mangyong Hill.

articles.title: Successful Underground Nuclear Test Hailed in DPRK
articles.content:
Successful Underground Nuclear Test Hailed in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, February 18 (KCNA) -- Army-people rallies took place in North Phyongan, Jagang and South Hamgyong provinces on Monday to hail the third underground nuclear test.
					 Present at the rallies were leading officials of the party and power organs and working people's organizations, service personnel of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, officials of factories, enterprises, co-operative farms, universities and colleges, teachers and students and other people in the province.
					
					 Speakers at the rallies said that the successful nuclear test is a historic event that smashed the brigandish campaign of "sanctions" launched by the U.S. in wanton violation of the DPRK's right to satellite launch for peaceful purposes.
					
					 The great victory is a brilliant fruition of the wise leadership of the the party, they said.
					
					 They called for bringing about a upswing in building a thriving nation with the pride of demonstrating the spirit of a nuclear weapons state.
					
					 They said that the nuclear test clearly showed the world that the DPRK showed that if the hostile forces continuously go on the rampage and stepped up the pressure on the DPRK, it would take tougher countermeasures
					
					 The speakers called for ending the confrontation with the U.S. that has lasted century after century and waging a dynamic struggle to build a thriving socialist nation, the most powerful nation in the world, on this land, united close around the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Venue of Kimjongilia Festival Draws Endless Stream of Visitors
articles.content:
Venue of Kimjongilia Festival Draws Endless Stream of Visitors 
						
 Pyongyang, February 18 (KCNA) -- At least 270 000 people have visited the venue of the 17th Kimjongilia Festival since it was opened on Feb. 14 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Among them were service persons, people from all walks of life, school youth and children, overseas Koreans and foreigners.
					
					 The stands of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces and the Korean People's Army unit commanded by Kim Song Dok, etc. arranged with flowers of the sun in a peculiar manner attracted particular attention of the visitors.
					
					 The visitors were seized by boundless reverence for Kim Jong Il, while looking round the stands of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, the Secretariat of the Cabinet of the DPRK, the Ministry of Light Industry, the Ministry of Public Health, the Ministry of Agriculture, etc.
					
					 Such profound reverence for the great man was clearly reflected by the stands of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea decorated with hundreds of potted Kimjongilias in full bloom and those immortal flowers from the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan and Koreans from various countries and regions. 
					
					 The visitors went round flowers of the sun contributed by diplomatic missions of foreign countries and international bodies here and friendship bodies in other countries and foreign figures.

articles.title: Officials in DPRK Vow to Achieve Victory in Decisive Battle with Enemies
articles.content:
Officials in DPRK Vow to Achieve Victory in Decisive Battle with Enemies
						
 Pyongyang, February 18 (KCNA) -- Officials of different social standings of the DPRK vowed to turn out in an all-out confrontation with hostile forces including the U.S., which is taking issue with the DPRK's measure for self-defense, and thus demonstrate the dignity and might of Songun Korea and achieve the victory without fail.
					 Hwang Yong Nam, department director of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Science and Technology, said:
					
					 The DPRK's successful nuclear test fully demonstrated that its army and people are dynamically advancing along the road chosen by themselves without the slightest vacillation despite enemy's provocation.
					
					 He vowed to give full play to intelligence and high caliber to push back the frontiers of latest science and technology by learning from the traits of the scientists and technicians who conquered space and succeeded in conducting the nuclear test.
					
					 Kim Hyong Nam, secretary of the Songyo District People's Committee, said that the nuclear test was the just step for self-defense taken by the Korean people, stressing that he will never allow the enemies to encroach upon the sovereignty and dignity of the country and nation even a bit.
					
					 Choe Yong Chol, manager of the Songyo Knitted Goods Factory, noted that this nuclear test dealt the hostile forces including the U.S. merciless blows.
					
					 The enemies must see the spirit of the Korean people who value the sovereignty and dignity of the country and nation, he stressed.
					
					 Jo Ju Yong, chief engineer of the Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex, said that the army and people of the DPRK will end the all-out confrontation with the U.S. that lasts century after century and triumphantly build a socialist thriving nation, the most powerful country on this land.

articles.title: Book "May Country of General Kim Jong Il Shine" (11) Published
articles.content:
Book "May Country of General Kim Jong Il Shine" (11) Published 
						
 Pyongyang, February 18 (KCNA) -- The book "May Country of General Kim Jong Il Shine" (11) was published in the DPRK.
					 It contains more than 390 songs, poems, words of songs, essays, occasional notes, travel sketches, etc. written by students. 
					
					  They highly praise the revolutionary lives and undying feats of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu who devoted all their tireless efforts to the bright future of the younger generation, possessed of the noble love for posterity and future as their inborn disposition. 
					
					 Reflected in their works are the students' ardent yearning and boundless reverence for Generalissimo Kim Jong Il who showed deep loving care for schoolchildren, making long journeys to mix with people and provide Songun leadership. 
					
					 The works deal with the excitement of the schoolchildren who are bringing their hopes and talents into full bloom under the loving care of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un. They emphasize that the future of the country is bright thanks to his warm loving care. 
					
					 The book also introduces the students who contributed the works to it, deals with motives for the creation of works and carries comments on them.

articles.title: Lyric Poem "Mother", One of Masterpieces in DPRK
articles.content:
Lyric Poem "Mother", One of Masterpieces in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, February 18 (KCNA) -- Lyric poem "Mother", composed by Kim Chol, who was a writer of the Central Committee of the Writers Union of Korea, is a hit speaking highly of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 It was dedicated to the birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il, the eternal leader of the WPK, scores of years ago.
					
					 The poem expresses gratitude to the WPK for taking good care of the people like their own mother.
					
					 Kim Yong Thaek, a writer of the C.C., the Writers Union of Korea, told KCNA:
					
					 "In his notes Kim Chol wrote, 'I just reflected the people's view of the WPK in the poem. The motherly party exactly means leader Kim Jong Il.'
					
					 Kim Jong Il's loving care for the people, regardless of their career or family backgrounds, led to the birth of such masterpiece.
					
					 The WPK is so admirable with Kim Jong Il as its eternal leader."
					
					 Kim Hyang Sim, a Pyongyang citizen, said:
					
					 "Such political party called motherly as the WPK can be found in no other countries.
					
					 The WPK regards it as its duty to work for the wellbeing of all the people."
					
					 Ri Chol Ho, an officer of the Korean People's Army, said:
					
					 "The lyric poem inspires servicepersons to unhesitatingly dedicate their lives for the sake of the WPK.
					
					 I would like to express heartfelt gratitude to Generalissimo Kim Jong Il for having built the WPK into a motherly party embracing all the people."

articles.title: Silk, Traditional Fabric in Korea
articles.content:
Silk, Traditional Fabric in Korea
 Pyongyang, February 18 (KCNA) -- Koreans have traditionally used silk in making quilts, pillows and clothes.
					 Hot in demand, silks are graceful and soft to skin, giving good effect to body.
					
					 In particular, they are highly resistant to bacteria and ultra-violet ray.
					
					 They also give massage effect to body, helping weaken skin itching.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries' Anti-DPRK Racket Slammed
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries' Anti-DPRK Racket Slammed
						
 Pyongyang, February 18 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionaries have become all the more desperate in kicking up confrontation with the DPRK after it conducted the third underground nuclear test for self-defence.
					 No sooner had the nuclear test been conducted than the Japanese conservative government loudly called for additional "sanctions" and Japan's own "sanctions", while asserting the need to "step up pressure".
					
					 Japanese Prime Minister Abe issued a "statement" the same day. In the statement he said that vice-chairmen of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) will not be allowed to reenter Japan in case they leave it for the purpose of making visits to the DPRK.
					
					 Timed to coincide with this, the payment of grants-in-aid for Korean schools in different parts of Japan including Kanagawa and Saitama Prefectures was suspended.
					
					 Gangsters of ultra-right conservative organizations flocked to the Central Hall of Chongryon and went on the rampage, shouting "Koreans go out of Japan."
					
					 On February 14, the government prodded police to arrest Kang Jong Bu of Kyoto Prefecture of Chongryon on charges of violation of "foreign currency law."
					
					 So sordid and horrible is the Japanese reactionaries' racket for confrontation with the DPRK.
					
					 Historically, whenever the DPRK's might was displayed, the Japanese reactionaries have persistently resorted to the moves to stamp out Chongryon, while raising "abduction issue", etc.
					
					 The moves to stamp out Chongryon has become all the pronounced after the Abe regime took office in September 2006, in particular.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries totally banned entry into Japanese ports of DPRK-flagged ships and enforced total prohibition of export to and import from the DPRK, ban on entry into Japan of any one with DPRK nationality and total suspension of visits of personnel and exchange of goods and money as part of Japan's own "sanctions" against the DPRK.
					
					 Japan has intensified the moves to seize the building of Chongryon and extended the embargo of ship Mangyongbong-92 and carried out a series of search into Chongryon institutions.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries' racket for "sanctions" against the DPRK and the moves to stamp out Chongryon have become all the more pronounced after Abe took power at the end of last year.
					
					 The Japanese conservative government will certainly be forced to pay dearly for its hostile act toward the DPRK as it has been engrossed in inhuman acts, far from redressing for the past crimes of inflicting mental and physical pain and sufferings on the Korean nation.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Warmongers' War Hysteria
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Warmongers' War Hysteria 
						
 Pyongyang, February 18 (KCNA) -- Kim Kwan Jin, "minister of Defense" of south Korea, was reported recently to have cried out for "getting ready to beat the north at the initial stage of war and cut off its windpipe" through missile strikes, talking about what he called "provocation". Meanwhile, the south Korean military let the three services of its armed forces stage three-dimensional war exercises across south Korea all at once under the simulated conditions of invasion of the north. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard: 
					
					 This is an absolutely intolerable military provocation against the DPRK. 
					
					 The south Korean regime is getting frantic with military provocations against the DPRK, not content with its anti-DPRK "sanctions" racket kicked up in collusion with outside forces over its legitimate step for self-defence. This is nothing but reckless actions to deliberately aggravate the situation on the Korean Peninsula and ignite a war against the DPRK at any cost. 
					
					 What traitor Kim Kwan Jin uttered was by no means invectives let loose by him by accident. It tells that he is again going into his incurable war hysteria as it is a revelation of his inveterate antipathy towards the fellow countrymen in the north and his wild ambition to invade it. 
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors in south Korea is more dead than alive, cursed and forsaken by all Koreans. It is so foolish as to escape its doom by igniting a war. This group is the root cause of all disasters of the Korean nation which should be removed at the earliest possible date as it is making its last-ditch efforts to seek a way out of its abyss of ruin. 
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK are fully ready to deal the most deadly and merciless retaliatory blows at the group. Its adventurous war scenario will only offer them a golden chance to achieve the historic cause of national reunification.

articles.title: U.S. and S. Korean Regime Urged to Roll Back Hostile Policies toward DPRK
articles.content:
U.S. and S. Korean Regime Urged to Roll Back Hostile Policies toward DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, February 18 (KCNA) -- The National Federation of Peasants Associations of south Korea issued a commentary on Feb. 14 urging the U.S. and the south Korean puppet regime to roll back their hostile policies toward the DPRK.
					 The commentary denounced the U.S. and the present "government" for making much fuss about "additional provocation" over the north's third underground nuclear test.
					
					 The prevailing grave situation is the natural outcome of the hostile policy pursued by the U.S. towards the DPRK over a long period and the severed south-north relations, it said, adding:
					
					 The historic course of the DPRK-U.S. confrontation which has lasted for over half a century goes to clearly prove that the hard-line policy backed by force can never bring the DPRK to its knees.
					
					 In order to clear away the dark clouds of a war hanging heavily over the Korean Peninsula, the U.S. should recognize the injustice of its hostile policy toward the DPRK and opt for dialogue for building a peace-keeping mechanism on the peninsula.
					
					 Standing at the crossroads of war and peace, the "government" should not stick to such humiliating methods as U.S.-Japan cooperation and UN "sanctions" but positively opt for improving the south-north relations from the stand of solving the issue of the peninsula in the spirit of "By our nation itself".
					
					 The commentary called for taking the road of implementing the south-north joint declarations and the road of exchange, cooperation and independent reunification, not confrontation and antagonism at a time when the Korean nation is facing a stern trial.

articles.title: S. Korean Police Accused of Tightening Gag on Media
articles.content:
S. Korean Police Accused of Tightening Gag on Media
						
 Pyongyang, February 18 (KCNA) -- The South Korean internet broadcasting service Voice of People on Friday condemned the police for kicking up a racket for suppressing media.
					 It said the " Institute for  Security Policy Studies " under the Police Agency in a document released  last year branded Voice of People, a legal medium, as "the one operated by the force disturbing security" and brought to light an attempt to crack down upon it.
					
					 It also blasted police for letting loose such sheer sophism that "cyber agents were massively escalating communist activities."
					
					 In the past, too, the authorities forced Minjok Ilbo, a progressive medium, to close on charges that "it praised, encouraged and sympathized with the north", and sentenced its manager Jo Yong Su to capital punishment. 
					
					 The broadcasting service termed as groundless police's charge that it is being run by the National Alliance for Democracy and National Reunification labeled as "an organization benefiting the enemy" and it echoed the assertions of the north and the forces following it and dismissed this as a serious libel.
					
					 If the police fail to take proper steps including official apology for this, the broadcasting service will hold them accountable for it, it warned.

articles.title: U.S. and Its Allies' "Sanctions" against DPRK Slammed: Organization of Koreans in Japan
articles.content:
U.S. and Its Allies' "Sanctions" against DPRK Slammed: Organization of Koreans in Japan
						
 Pyongyang, February 18 (KCNA) -- The Federation of South Koreans in Japan for Democracy and Unification, an organization of Koreans in Japan, on Feb. 12 issued a statement denouncing the U.S. and its allies for making desperate efforts to toughen "sanctions" against the DPRK.
					 Tensions are rising on the Korean Peninsula, the statement said, adding that the fabrication of the U.S.-masterminded "resolution on sanctions" against the DPRK at the UN Security Council led to the present situation.
					
					 Taking issue with the north's satellite launch and imposing "sanctions" on it are a wanton violation of the sovereignty of an independent state, it held, and added:
					
					 After the fabrication of the "resolution on sanctions", the U.S. held combined naval drills with south Korea with the involvement of even a nuclear submarine, thus getting on the nerves of the north.
					
					 Past pressures upon the DPRK only aggravated the situation, the statement said, resolutely opposing the U.S.-backed "sanctions" that may lead to a war.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work off Press in Bangladesh
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work off Press in Bangladesh
						
 Pyongyang, February 18 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "Socialism Is a Science" was published in booklet by the S. R. Print Media Publishing House in Dhaka, Bangladesh.
					 The work made public on Nov. 1, Juche 83 (1994) clarifies the idea that Korean-style socialism based on a Juche-oriented theory of socialism is most scientific and vital socialism and the principled issues arising in defending socialism.
					
					 A book releasing ceremony took place in Dhaka on Feb. 12.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Given Publicity in Guinea
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Given Publicity in Guinea
						
 Pyongyang, February 18 (KCNA) -- The New Year Address made by the dear respected Kim Jong Un was carried in a special bulletin jointly issued by the Guinean preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) and the Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea on Feb. 9.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Lauded in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Lauded in Foreign Countries
						
 Pyongyang, February 18 (KCNA) -- Seminars on leader Kim Jong Il's feats took place in Russia, Bangladesh, Britain, France and Ethiopia between Feb. 4 and 12 to mark his birth anniversary.
					 Present there were figures of the Nakhodka City Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, Bangladesh People's League, Bangladesh Self-Reliance Research Centre, Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist), Northern Regional Committee of the France-Korea Friendship Association and the Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea and masses.
					
					 The first secretary of the Nakhodka City Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation extended invariable support and solidarity to the just cause of the Korean people at a time when the U.S. imperialists were getting evermore frantic in their moves to stifle the DPRK.
					
					 The president of the Bangladesh People's League praised Kim Jong Il possessed of personality and qualifications as a great man at the highest level as a prominent thinker and theoretician and statesman who led the party, the army and the people to victory with his profound ideas and theories and extraordinary leadership.
					
					 The vice-chairman and international secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist) praised Kim Jong Il for turning the DPRK into a politico-ideological and military power and an invincible bulwark of socialism, shattering the imperialists' moves to stifle it.
					
					 The chairman of the Northern Regional Committee of the France-Korea Friendship Association paid the highest tribute to Kim Jong Il, adding the immortal exploits he performed on behalf of the human cause of independence will always be remembered by the French people.

articles.title: Celebrations Held in Different Countries to Mark Birth Anniversary of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Celebrations Held in Different Countries to Mark Birth Anniversary of Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, February 18 (KCNA) -- Meetings took place in France, Switzerland, Iceland, the Dominican Republic, Myanmar and Ukraine from Feb. 8 to 12 to celebrate the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star).
					 On display in their venues were photos on revolutionary activities of Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also displayed there were photos and books introducing the invincible might of Songun Korea.
					
					 The international secretary of the Central Committee of the French Revolutionary Communist League said that the whole life of Kim Jong Il is characterized by justice, patriotism and defence of peace as he firmly protected the sovereignty and dignity of the DPRK and made a great contribution to global peace and security under the uplifted banner of Songun.
					
					 Jon Arni Halldorsson, secretary general of the Iceland-DPRK Friendship and Cultural Society, praised Kim Jong Il as the great master of ideology, theory, leadership and independent politics and tender-hearted father of the people.
					
					 Ivan Rodriguez, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Revolutionary Alternative Party of Dominica, praised Kim Jong Il as the great leader who turned the DPRK into a power by carrying forward the revolutionary idea and cause of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The director of the Sports and Physical Education Institute in Yangon, Myanmar said that Kim Jong Il would always be remembered by the Korean people and the world progressives for his great life and exploits.
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting in Switzerland.

articles.title: Mexican Political Figure Lauds Feats of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Mexican Political Figure Lauds Feats of Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, February 18 (KCNA) -- Cuautemoc Amezcua Dromundo, chairman of the Central Committee of the Socialist Popular Party of Mexico, issued a statement on Feb. 11 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Saying February 16 is the significant day which marks the 71st anniversary of his birth, the chairman continued:
					
					 Kim Jong Il is the eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, peerlessly brilliant Songun commander and tender-hearted father of the Korean people as he developed the WPK into the most revolutionary and powerful popular party and turned the DPRK into a socialist fortress.
					
					 The Socialist Popular Party of Mexico is convinced that the Songun revolutionary cause of Juche pioneered by President Kim Il Sung and guided by Kim Jong Il is sure to triumph as the dear respected Kim Jong Un is steering the Korean revolution.
					
					 The WPK and the Korean people will surely achieve the cause of building a thriving socialist nation and achieving the reunification of the country, the lifetime desire of Kim Jong Il, firmly rallied behind Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Nigeria Congratulates DPRK on Its Successful Third Underground Nuclear Test
articles.content:
Nigeria Congratulates DPRK on Its Successful Third Underground Nuclear Test
						
 Pyongyang, February 18 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held at Nasarawa Provincial University of Nigeria on Feb. 12 to hail the DPRK's successful third underground nuclear test.
					 Present there were the chiefs and members of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea and its affiliated organizations and professors and students of the university.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 The head of the Political Department of the Sociology Faculty of the university said that the DPRK conducted an underground nuclear test as part of its practical countermeasure to protect its sovereignty from the hostile action taken by the U.S. in wanton violation of its legitimate right to satellite launch for peaceful purposes.
					
					 The recent nuclear test will encourage the service personnel and people of the DPRK in their drive to build a thriving nation and mark an important occasion in defending the peace and stability of the Korean Peninsula and the region, the head noted, adding:
					
					 Nigeria should learn from the DPRK to build its own strength.
					
					 The speakers warmly congratulated the DPRK on its successful nuclear test, unanimously saying the DPRK is the best.

articles.title: Egyptian Political Party Supports DPRK's Stand to Protect Its Sovereignty
articles.content:
Egyptian Political Party Supports DPRK's Stand to Protect Its Sovereignty
 Pyongyang, February 18 (KCNA) -- The National Progressive Unionist Party of Egypt made public a statement on Feb. 6 in support of the Korean people's just cause.
					 The statement extended solidarity to the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) in its efforts to build a thriving socialist nation and protect the sovereignty and dignity of the country.
					
					 It said that the principled and steadfast stand taken by the DPRK toward the UN Security Council's "resolution on sanctions" against it over its satellite launch for peaceful purposes is a very just step in line with the desire of independent countries.
					
					 It expressed full support for the WPK and the Korean people in their struggle to ensure peace and security on the Korean Peninsula and in the rest of the world and achieve the reunification of the country free from interference of outsiders.
					
					 It wished the Korean people greater success in their efforts to build an economic giant under the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the WPK.

articles.title: Korean People's Just Cause Supported in Russia
articles.content:
Korean People's Just Cause Supported in Russia
						
 Pyongyang, February 18 (KCNA) -- A meeting took place before the U.S. consulate in Vladivostok of Russia on Feb. 6 to support the Korean people in their just cause and denounce the U.S. moves to stifle the DPRK.
					 It was attended by personages of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, the Maritime Territory Legislative Assembly of Russia and the Lenin Young Communist League of the Russian Federation and masses.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 Anatoli Dolgachev, member of the Maritime Territory Legislative Assembly of Russia, said:
					
					 The U.S., boss of the world imperialists, prodded the UN Security Council into cooking up an inhuman "resolution" against the DPRK.
					
					 The UN is no longer an organization speaking for the interests of all countries but has been reduced to a tool of the U.S. for aggression.
					
					 The UNSC's "resolution" to block the economic development of the DPRK does not work on the Maritime Territory.
					
					 The participants of the meeting bitterly denounced the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK, trampling on the Stars and Stripes and tearing off literature symbolic of the UNSC's "resolution."
					
					 They voiced full support and solidarity with the DPRK in its just cause of further increasing its military capability for self-defence, waving DPRK flags and placards bearing slogans critical of the U.S. imperialists.

articles.title: Russians Hail DPRK's Underground Nuclear Test
articles.content:
Russians Hail DPRK's Underground Nuclear Test
						
 Pyongyang, February 18 (KCNA) -- Russian figures made public statements on Feb. 12 to hail the DPRK's successful underground nuclear test.
					 Anatoli Dolgachev, member of the Maritime Territory Legislative Assembly of Russia, said that the recent nuclear test of the DPRK fully demonstrated its will to defend the sovereignty and security of the country.
					
					 It was a natural product of the U.S. hateful hostile policy toward the DPRK, he added.
					
					 Denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula is possible only when the whole world is denuclearized, he noted, stressing it is preposterous for the nuclear weapons states to take issue with the DPRK's nuclear test.
					
					 The powerful nuclear deterrence of the DPRK provides a sure guarantee for protecting the peace and security on the Korean Peninsula and in Northeast Asia, he added.
					
					 Baranikova, chief editor of the Russian paper We Serve the Country, extended congratulations to the independent and dignified DPRK. 
					
					 She said:
					
					 The recent nuclear test successfully conducted by the DPRK despite the increasing pressure of the imperialist allied forces is evoking admiration among progressive people.
					
					 An unstable situation is prevailing in the Asia-Pacific region due to the U.S. moves for aggression.
					
					 The DPRK will bolster up its nuclear deterrence to protect its interests and security.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de difunta Kim Rak Hui
articles.content:
U.S. and Its Allies' "Sanctions" against DPRK Slammed: Organization of Koreans in Japan
						
 Pyongyang, February 18 (KCNA) -- The Federation of South Koreans in Japan for Democracy and Unification, an organization of Koreans in Japan, on Feb. 12 issued a statement denouncing the U.S. and its allies for making desperate efforts to toughen "sanctions" against the DPRK.
					 Tensions are rising on the Korean Peninsula, the statement said, adding that the fabrication of the U.S.-masterminded "resolution on sanctions" against the DPRK at the UN Security Council led to the present situation.

articles.title: Mitines provinciales para felicitar exito de tercera prueba nuclear
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de difunta Kim Rak Hui
						
Pyongyang, 18 de febrero (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un envio una ofrenda floral ante el feretro de la difunta Kim Rak Hui, diputada a la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y consejera honorifica del Consejo de Ministros, en senal de profundas condolencias por su fallecimiento.

articles.title: Reaccionarios japoneses se enfrascan en campana anti-RPDC
articles.content:
Mitines provinciales para felicitar exito de tercera prueba nuclear
						
Pyongyang, 18 de febrero (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 18 en las provincias de Phyong-an del Norte, de Jagang y de Hamgyong del Sur los mitines de los uniformados y civiles para felicitar el exito de la tercera prueba nuclear subterranea.
					Tomaron parte en las ocasiones los funcionarios de las instituciones del partido y el Poder y de las entidades de masas en citadas provincias, los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea y del Ejercito de Seguridad Interior del Pueblo de Corea, los funcionarios, trabajadores, profesores, empleados y estudiantes de las fabricas, empresas, granjas cooperativas, institutos superiores y escuelas especializadas.
					
					Los oradores senalaron que el exito de la tercera prueba nuclear subterranea constituye un acontecimiento historico que frustro tajantemente el alboroto de "sancion" del imperio yanqui que violo flagrantemente el derecho de la RPDC a lanzar los satelites con fines pacificos.
					
					Tal gran victoria es el gran producto de la sabia direccion del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, destacaron y manifestaron sus determinaciones de registrar auges en la construccion del estado prospero con la dignidad de haber ostentado el impetu del pais con armas nucleares.
					
					Se refirieron a que a traves de la presente prueba nuclear el pais demostro a todo el mundo que se tomaran las contramedidas mas fuertes si las fuerzas hostiles intensifican la presion desesperandose de manera imprudente.
					
					Exhortaron a todos a luchar con tenacidad por acabar con la confrontacion antiyanqui prolongada de siglo en siglo, y construir sobre este territorio patrio el estado prospero socialista uniendose con firmeza en torno al Mariscal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Reaccionarios japoneses se enfrascan en campana anti-RPDC (continua)
articles.content:
Reaccionarios japoneses se enfrascan en campana anti-RPDC
						
　Pyongyang, 18 de febrero (ACNC) -- Con motivo de la tercera prueba nuclear subterranea de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea se llega al climax la campana conflictiva de los reaccionarios japoneses contra esta.
					　Tan pronto se realizo el dia 12 la prueba nuclear de la RPDC, el poder conservador japones insistio en la necesidad de aplicar la "sancion" adicional y la separada diciendo que "se debe intensificar la presion sobre esta".
					
					　El mismo dia, el premier japones Abe en su "declaracion" tomo la medida de no permitir el regreso de los vicepresidentes del Presidium del Comite Central de la Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon (Chongryon) en el caso de que salgan del pais para visitar a la RPDC.
					
					　Coincidiendo con el tiempo, los reaccionarios interrumpieron el pago de subsidio a las escuelas coreanas de distintas localidades de Japon incluyendo el departamento de Kanagawa y Saitama.
					
					　Los gangsteres ultraderechistas hicieron alborotos frente a la casa cultural del CC de la Chongryon gritando "!Fuera los coreanos de Japon!"
					
					　El dia 14, los policias arrestaron a Kang Jong Bu, compatriota de Kyoto de la Chongryon, bajo la sospecha de la violacion de la "ley de divisas".

articles.title: Editada coleccion de obras "Brilla, pais del General Kim Jong Il" (tomo 11)
articles.content:
Editada coleccion de obras "Brilla, pais del General Kim Jong Il" (tomo 11)
Pyongyang, 18 de febrero (ACNC) -- Quedo editada en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea la coleccion de obras "Brilla, pais del General Kim Jong Il" (tomo 11).
					La coleccion recoge mas de 390 canciones y poesias infantiles, letras de canciones, ensayos, fragmentos, notas de viaje, etc.
					
					Los articulos alaban la vida revolucionaria y las imperecederas hazanas de los grandes hombres sin iguales del monte Paektu quienes con su sublime amor innato a las generaciones venideras dedicaron esfuerzos para el radiante porvenir de la nueva generacion.
					
					Reflejan la infinita anoranza y el sentimiento de veneracion de los ninos escolares al Generalisimo Kim Jong Il quien dispenso la  gran benevolencia a todos los ninos coreanos continuando durante toda su vida el largo camino del Songun.
					
					Transmiten la pasion de los ninos escolares quienes florecen a su antojo su deseo y habilidades bajo el amor del Mariscal Kim Jong Un puntualizando que sera radiante el porvenir de ellos en el regazo del Mariscal.
					
					En la coleccion tambien se pueden leer la presentacion de los escritores, el motivo de creacion y la evaluacion sobre las obras.
